name: eclipse-theia-14309
description: Sample VS Code extension to verify viewsWelcome behavior in Eclipse Theia: https://github.com/eclipse-theia/theia/issues/14309

viewsWelcome.contents:
$(heart) $(heart-filled) $(robot) This content is always visible and enabled
[Primary button](command:eclipse-theia-14309.helloWorld)
A [command link](command:eclipse-theia-14309.helloWorld), an [https link](https://github.com/eclipse-theia/theia/issues/14309), and a [file link](file:///package.json)

This is the same as above but is always disabled
[Primary button](command:eclipse-theia-14309.helloWorld)
A [command link](command:eclipse-theia-14309.helloWorld), an [https link](https://github.com/eclipse-theia/theia/issues/14309), and a [file link](file:///package.json). Only the command based links and buttons participate in the enablement check.

This content is enabled when the 'foo' context is set. Use the 'setEnablementContextFoo' command.
[Primary button](command:eclipse-theia-14309.helloWorld)
A [command link](command:eclipse-theia-14309.helloWorld), an [https link](https://github.com/eclipse-theia/theia/issues/14309), and a [file link](file:///package.json). Hidden when 'a' context is set. Use the 'setWhenContextA' command to hide it.

This content is enabled when the 'bar' context is set. Use the 'setEnablementContextBar' command.
[Primary button](command:eclipse-theia-14309.helloWorld)
A [command link](command:eclipse-theia-14309.helloWorld), an [https link](https://github.com/eclipse-theia/theia/issues/14309), and a [file link](file:///package.json). Hidden when 'b' content is set. Use the 'setWhenContextB' command to hide it.
